sentences: Meie vanemad lubasid meil 천htul kodus j채tta.
Kas sa t천esti lubasid teil koos s천ita?
context: The word 'lubasid' is the past tense, plural form of the Estonian verb 'luba', which means 'to promise'. It is used when referring to a group of people who made promises in the past. The singular form would be 'lubas' (he/she promised), while the first person plural would be 'lubasime' (we promised).
